text: the dow jones industrials and the
overall market had a very bad day again
today the second one in a row together
we're down almost ten percent on the dow
without the past two days investors are
extremely fearful we saw them rushing
into Treasury bills today at a rate and
haven't been seen since nineteen
fifty-five in fact the yields on
Treasuries were pushed close to zero
it's an amazing rush to safety that you
often see during times like this but
what has happened today that was
different from say yesterday or even
last week when we were still in this
very difficult period is that the wheels
of commerce the things that really drive
commerce in this country the bank
lending the financing of mortgages the
financing of company's operations really
ground to a halt today and this is very
troubling to many people because what
this means is we now have the chance of
this financial Maelstrom which up until
now has been pretty much limited to the
financial world you know banks brokerage
firms mortgage lending units this now
has the potential to expand into the
overall economy and really start
translating into trouble there luckily
up until now we have been able we've
been seeing a pretty strong economy in
spite of these troubles and so now if it
does start to have an impact there
that's really going to take away some of
the positives that we've had up until
now
